channel.title: Portforwarding-followed guides seemingly simple questions
channel.description:
i have set up a server and am now trying to et the portforwarding to work. i have a no-ip host and the DUC is running i have a router it is a netgear MR814. my suspicions are that i have entered the wrong ip adress or port under either the no-ip host or the router. how do i go about finding the right one to put on? are they the same for both the router and the no-ip or different? any help for be much appreciated
EDIT:also im on windows xp if that makes any difference and also wondering if there is a way to cehck if my server is online once i think it may be working.

item.title: Portforwarding-followed guides seemingly simple questions
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

On my other windows pc, ipconfig isnt recognised. So if this doesen’t work, you will have to find an alternative.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding-followed guides seemingly simple questions
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Open Run Type “cmd”
Command Prompt Should Come Up Type “ipconfig”
The You Should See These 3 Things

Ip Address…:192.168.X.X <-------- Computer’s Ip
Subnet Mask…:XXX.XXX.XXX.X
Default Gateway…:192.168.X.X <---------- Router’s Ip

Open Up Your Browser And Type Your Router’s Ip
Enter Your Username And Pass.
Then When Portforwading Use Your Computer’s Ip

Check Tutorial Section For A Tut

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding-followed guides seemingly simple questions
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

You should be portforwarding from your router to somthing like: 192.168.1.xxx

On NO-IP it will be somthing like: 92.xx.xx.xx

Hope this helps

Durial12

Read full topic
